To view / add your air-quality device, please fill up the details below and sign-in / up into your account
Don\'t have account yet ? Sign up.

Air Quality India application provides you with Real time Air quality data from all across India. The data has been measured as per the standard norms given by Central Pollution Control Board of India.
Air Quality India App shows air quality based on the following parameters:
Particulate matter and particulate microns (PM 2.5 and PM10)
The hazardous and polluting gases in the atmosphere.
Gases like CO, CO2, SOx, Nox, So2, No2.
Humidity and temperature of the atmosphere.

Activity suggestion by Air Quality India app gives you suggestions based on pollution level in your area. Is it a good time to go for morning exercise? Should you take your pet for a walk? The activity suggestion by Air Quality India App gives you all the suggestions.

Air is a dynamic medium there is so much about it that you might be unaware about. Increase your pool of knowledge with the Knowledge centre provided by Air Quality India App. It has all the facts, informations and statistics about Air Pollution and Air Quality across the globe. The knowledge center acts as an encyclopedia about air.
Air Quality App allows you to compare the pollution levels of various cities.
With city comparison you can make wiser choices when planning your next vacation or shifting to a new area.

Add your own device into the Air quality India app. If you have purchased your DIY Air Quality Monitor, Airowl, you can add it and configure with the Air Quality India App. Air Quality India App gives you the chance to access the data and share the data of your device to the public and contribute to fight against pollution.
Last but not the least, Get notified whenever there are changes in the air quality or rise in the pollution levels and plan your activities.
Want to find your nearest location?

The AQI is an \"index\" determined by calculating the degree of pollution in the city or at the monitoring point and includes five main pollutants - particulate matter, ground-level ozone, sulfur dioxide, carbon monoxide and nitrogen dioxide. Each of these pollutants have an air quality standard which is used to calculate the overall AQI for the city.
Air quality is considered satisfactory and air pollution poses little or no risk.
Air quality is acceptable, however, for some pollutants there may be a moderate health concern for a very small number of people who are usually sensitive to air pollution.
Everyone may begin to experience health effects; members of sensitive group may experience more serious health issues.
Health warning of emergency conditions. The entire population is more likely to be affected.
Health alert: everyone may experience more serious health effects.

In numbers, AQI is represented between 0 to 500 with 0 representing good air and 500 hazardous air. For better understanding and presentation, the AQI is broken down into six categories, each color coded with the number scale.
Level of pollution aroud your space
